result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristin L Steen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Kristin L Steen was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristin L Steen is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Kristin L Steen was found guilty of Arson of Property Other Than Building, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.
  • Kristin L Steen was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**4 days jail credit, if revoked.**

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: INVOICE FROM DR. GALLI FOR TESTIMONY - $1350.00

3:26 p.m. Defendant Kristin L Steen in court, in custody.  Appears by phone from the Waupaca County Jail.  Court addresses her request for huber privileges to be restored.  Court addresses her request to have huber restored for her appointments.  Court reinstates huber for appointments only.
from Court to defendant denying defendant's requesting regarding sentence
1:41 p.m.  Defendant Kristin L Steen in court, in custody.  Huber Revocation. Kristin explains why she didn't get back in time from her Huber Privileges.  Court revokes Huber Privileges.

Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 11:33 Defendant Kristin L Steen in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:58 Defendant Kristin L Steen in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motions in limine:
#10 - Dr. Galli's report and potential testimony is discussed. Court denies motion.
9:12 Court in recess.
9:18 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Attorney Lambert puts on record that doors were closed during motion hearing, but doors are open now.
9:21 Jury is brought into courtroom. Court reads preliminary jury instructions.
9:23 Attorney Slattery gives opening statement.
9:28 Attorney Lambert gives opening statement. 
9:31 Kent Berney is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Slattery. He is a licensed psychologist. Testifies as to education and employment. Testifies as to doing NGI evaluations. Exhibit #7 is marked and reviewed with witness. Testifies as to his findings from his interview and evaluation of the defendant.
10:47 Jury in recess. Parties discuss objection. Court sustains objection. Court admonishes Attorney Slattery that testimony should be by question and answer and not repeating testimony.
10:52 Court in recess.
11:12 Court reconvenes with presence of jury. Attorney Slattery continues cross-examining witness, Dr. Berney. His conclusion is that the defendant has a mental illness and the crime committed was a result of it. 
11:21 Attorney Lambert cross-examines witness. 
11:25 Attorney Slattery redirects. Exhibit #7 is received.
11:27 Michael Galli is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a licensed clinical psychologist. Testifies as to his education and employment. Testifies as to how is does NGI evaluations. Exhibit #8 is marked and reviewed with witness. Testifies as to his findings of his evaluation of the defendant. Exhibit #8 is received. He does not feel that defendant has the type of mental illness that supports an NGI plea.
11:48 Court in recess.
1:06 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Attorney Slattery requests that verdict of both counts be answered together. Attorney Lambert requests that the two be separated. Counts will be separated for verdicts. Jury instructions are discussed.
1:15 Jury is brought into courtroom. Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness, Michael Galli. 
1:50 Attorney Lambert redirects. 
1:56 Jury is removed from courtroom. Objection is discussed. Objection is overruled.
2:03 Jurors are brought back into courtroom. Attorney Lambert continues questioning witness Michael Galli. 
2:06 Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. 
2:08 Dr. Berney is recalled as rebuttal witness and questioned by Attorney Slattery. 
2:21 Attorney Lambert cross-examines witness. 
State and defense rest.
2:24 Court in recess.
2:40 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Jury instructions are discussed. 
2:43 Jury is brought into courtroom. Court reads jury instructions. 
2:55 Attorney Slattery gives closing statement. 
3:10 Attorney Lambert gives closing statement.
3:13 Attorney Slattery gives rebuttal statement. 
3:16 Court gives closing jury instructions.
3:17 Carl Lemke and Wayne Tracy are sworn as court officers and jurors retire to deliberate. Court puts on record sidebar from this morning regarding sequestration.
3:18 Court in recess.
4:19 jruy returns with verdict of Yes to question 1 and No to question 2 to counts 1 & 3. On dissenting juror. Court polls jury as a whole. Attorney Slattery requests that jury be polled individually. Court polls jury individually. 
4:25 Jury is dismissed. Attorney Lambert moves for entry of conviction on counts 1 & 3. Court enters judgment on counts 1 & 3. Sentencing set for later date. Bond is continued.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 11:30 am.

9:08 Defendant Kristin L Steen in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motions in limine. 
#1 - No objection - Granted.
#2 - No objection - Granted.
#3 - No objection - Granted.
#4 - State objects and makes statement. Attorney Slattery makes statement. Will be dealt with if it comes up.
#5 - State does not object except for officer and if granted, sequestration should apply to defense as well. Granted after jury selection. Officer may remain in courtroom.
#6 - State objects. Attorney Slattery makes statement. Court will announce that witnesses can be called by either side.
#7 - Witness, M.D., has two prior criminal convictions.
#8 - Attorney Slattery withdraws motion. Attorney Lambert states he will be saying that defendant was a patient at Norwood. Attorney Slattery agrees that the jury will know anyway.
#9 - No objection but states that witnesses may say something about their experience with defendant, but he will not ask questions about it. Attorney Slattery makes statement. Granted.
#10 - Motion will be handled tomorrow if necessary.
Jury instruction 601 is discussed.
9:25 Court in recess.
9:40 Court reconvenes and jurors are brought into courtroom and sworn. 
9:46 Twenty jurors are called to the box and Court reads charges and begins voir dire. Juror #160 is struck for cause. 
9:58 Attorney Lambert does voir dire. 
10:16 Attorney Slattery does voir dire. Juror #180 is struck for cause.
10:34 Strikes are made. 
10:46 Twelve jurors are sworn. 
10:47 Attorney Lambert gives opening statement.
10:55 Attorney Slattery gives opening statement. 
11:03 Court in recess.
11:24 Court reconvenes. Kim Wunrow is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. She is employed as an RN at Norwood Health Care Center. On 4/3/15, there was a fire in a patient's room. People were leaving the building and the defendant was sitting on the bed and she was ripping the stuffing out of her pillow and feeding the fire. She tried to get defendant out of the room, but defendant refused and physically resisted. Other employees tried to get her to leave. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
11:28 Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. 
11:34 April Jensen is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. She is employed as a CNA at Norwood Health Care Center. She states on 4/3/15, there was a fire at Norwood in the defendant's room. She observed flames on the bed and she extinguished the fire with a fire extinguisher. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
11:37 Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. 
11:43 Attorney Lambert redirects. 
11:47 Rainy Keuntjes is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. She is employed by Norwood Health Care Center. On 4/3/15, she was assigned to defendant's room and she was told to give her some space. When she was outside the room, she noticed there was a fire on the bed. She tried to smother the fire with blankets. She sustained minor burns on her arms and smoke inhalation from trying to put out the fire.
11:51 Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. 
11:58 Jurors in recess. Objection is discussed. 
12:10 Court in recess.
1:09 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Court overrules objection.
1:11 Jury is brought back into courtroom. Court advises jury that he is overruling objection. Attorney Slattery continues cross-examining witness, Rainy Keuntjes.
1:22 Elizabeth Masanz is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. She is employed as Director of Nursing at Norwood Health Care Center. On 4/3/15, she observed damage from the fire. Testifies as to what the damages were. Exhibits #1 & 2 are marked and reviewed with witness. 
1:26 Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. Exhibit #3 is marked and reviewed with witness. 
1:33 Jury in recess to discuss objection.
1:37 Jury is brought back into courtroom. Attorney Slattery continues cross-examining witness, Elizabeth Masanz.
1:39 Attorney Lambert redirects. 
1:40 Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. 
1:43 Attorney Lambert redirects. Exhibit #4 is marked and reviewed with witness. Attorney Slattery objects to exhibit. Court receives exhibit. 
1:48 Blake Borchardt is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. On 4/3/15, he was dispatched to Norwood Health Care Center regarding a fire. He and Sgt. Petro were both dressed in full police uniform. He observed patient and staff standing outside. He observed smoke in the building. He was advised that the defendant started the fire and would not leave the building. He requested defendant to leave 2 times and she had to be physically removed from the building, which she continued to resist. He observed burned clothing and burns on the defendant's legs. He spoke to her at the police department and she told him how she started the fire and why she started the fire. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.
1:56 Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. 
2:04 Attorney Lambert redirects. 
2:06 Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. 
2:08 Sari Goodness is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. She is a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. She was dispatched on 4/3/15 to Norwood Health Care Center regarding a fire. Exhibits #1 & 2 are marked and reviewed with witness. She took the photos. Exhibits #1 & 2 are received. Exhibits are published to the jury. 
2:11 Attorney Slattery cross-exmaines witness. Exhibits #5 & 6 are marked and reviewed with witness. Exhibits are received and will be published to the jury. 
2:14 State rests.
2:15 Jury in recess. Court discusses whether some witnesses can be dismissed. Rainy Keuntjes may be excused. All other witnesses must remain. 
2:19 Court in recess.
2:37 Court reconvenes. Darren Larson is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Slattery. He is an officer with the Marshfield Police Department. In April of 2015, he investigated a fire at the Norwood Health Care Center.  He testifies that he talked to Rainy Keuntjes. They have no documentation as to injuries that she received as a result of the fire. 
2:44 Attorney Lambert cross-examines witness. 
2:47 April Jensen is recalled as a witness and questioned by Attorney Slattery. 
2:49 Melody Steen is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Slattery. She is married to defendant. She testifies as to Kristin's mental health. She suspected defendant had stopped taking medications in the spring of 2015. Testifies as to her behavior when she stops taking her medication. Testifies as to things that may have been stressing her out during that time. Testifies that on 4/2/15, she noticed that Kristin and her medications were missing. She feared defendant had overdosed. She talked to her on the phone and Kristin was slurring her words. She called 911. She was located at Dexter Park and was transported to St. Joseph's Hospital. She was then transported to Norwood. She testifies that Kristin was very angry that she was there. She states she has been convicted of a crime twice. 
3:03 Attorney Lambert cross-examines witness.
3:07 Aleesha Brundidge is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Slattery. She is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. On 4/2/15, she was dispatched to North Wood County Park to look for a suicidal person. She located defendant at Dexter Park. Defendant had prescription medications with her and defendant said she overdosed on them. 
3:14 Court in recess. 
3:29 Cout reconvenes without presence of jury. Attorney Slattery states defendant will not testify. Court questions defendant and she states it is her decision not to testify.
3:32 Jury is brought into courtroom. Defense rests.
3:33 Jury is in recess. Jury instructions are discussed.
3:40 Court in recess.
3:52 Court reconvenes with presence of jury. Court reads jury instructions. 
4:12 Attorney Lambert gives closing statement.
4:22 Attorney Slattery gives closing statement.
4:31 Attorney Lambert gives closing rebuttal statement.
4:36 Court gives closing jury instructions.
4:40 Bailiffs Dave Hoks and Jean Drollinger are sworn as court officers and jurors retire to deliberate. 
5:14 Jurors return with verdict of guilty to counts 1 & 3 and not guilty to count 2. Court polls jury as a whole.
5:18 Jury in recess until 9:00 tomorrow. Based on jury's verdict, count 2 is dismissed. Court accepts verdict on counts 1 & 3.
5:21 Court in recess until 8:30 a.m. tomorrow.

11:19 Defendant Kristin L Steen in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Competency report has been received. Attorney Slattery requests additional time to review report. Requests matter be set for PTC. State does not object. Victim's rights have been complied with.
Court grants adjournment.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 11:00 am.
FAX confirmation of Order for Examination
for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

8:36 Defendant Kristin L Steen in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to Not Guilty and Not Guilty by reason of reason of mental defect. 
Court orders NGI evaluation.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

10:34 Defendant Kristin L Steen in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Blake Borchardt is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. On 4/3/15, he was dispatched to Norwood Health Care Facilities because of a fire. Staff indicated to him who started the fire. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. The defendant had burns on her body and admitted to starting the fire. 
Darren Larson is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a lieutenant with the Marshfield Police Department. He assisted with the investigation of the fire. Three staff members were treated at the hospital because of the fire. Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 05-07-2015 10:30 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kristin L Steen in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Take all prescribed medications & commitments assigned by doctor.
